title: 1stMate
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<Name|1stMate>>
<<Portrait|1stMate_happy>>
Hello, Captain.
<</Textbox>>

[[That's all.|1stMate.EndConv]]

[[Do you know anything about $Clue ?|1stMate.Clue]]

title: 1stMate.Clue
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<Name|Captain>>
Do you know anything about $CLUE?
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<Name|1stMate>>
<<Portrait|1stMate_neutral>>
I do believe that $CLUE is mine, sir. If I may ask, why is it in your possession?
<</Textbox>>

[[I found it at $CRIMESCENE.|1stMate.Reply]]

[[That's none of your business.|1stMate.Retort]]

title: 1stMate.Reply
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<Name|Captain>>
I found it in $CRIMESCENE, I figured it could help the investigation.
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<Name|1stMate>>
<<Portrait|1stMate_neutral>>
Is that so? I usually keep it in $LOCATION just in case I'd need it. As for why it was where there? I do not know.
<</Textbox>>

[[What exactly does this $CLUE do?|1stMate.KeyDialogue]]

[[I feel like you're lying.|1stMate.Retort]]

title: 1stMate.KeyDialogue
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<Name|Captain>>
What exactly does this $CLUE do?
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<Name|1stMate>>
<<Portrait|1stMate_neutral>>
Many things. It's simple, but versatile.
<</Textbox>>

//Unlock Clue Key Dialogue

[[That's all.|1stMate.EndConv]]

title: 1stMate.Retort
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<Name|Captain>>
I feel like you're only telling me half of what you know.
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|1stMate>>
<<Portrait|1stMate_upset>>
I'm dissapointed in what's become of you, Captain. You've got some growing up to do.
<</Textbox>>

<<set $loyalty to $loyalty - 1>>

//End conversation
